text: Timothy Joseph Hill (born May 21, 1958) is an American movie director, screenwriter, voice actor and producer. ==Career== Hill began his career in the 1990s as a television writer, director, storyboard artist and editor for Rocko's Modern Life (with Stephen Hillenburg), Exit 57, KaBlam!, SpongeBob SquarePants, Ed, Edd n Eddy (with Danny Antonucci) and Kenny the Shark. He also created the KaBlam! skit Action League Now!! Hill directed the movies Muppets from Space, Max Keeble's Big Move, Garfield: A Tail of Two Kitties, Alvin and the Chipmunks, and Hop (movie). Hill was a screenwriter for The SpongeBob SquarePants Movie. He later directed another SpongeBob movie The SpongeBob Movie: Sponge on the Run. ==Personal life== Hill has been married to actress Veronica Alicino, whom he frequently casts in minor roles in his films, since June 24, 1997. He is the nephew of director George Roy Hill. ==Other websites== * Category:1958 births Category:Living people Category:Writers from Minneapolis Category:American movie directors Category:American voice actors Category:American screenwriters Category:American animators Category:American editors
title: Tim Hill
